draft_attributes.title: Which security standard would you use for web application development:

feedback.incorrect:
Sorry! That answer is incorrect.

Why?
· OWASP cheat sheets are not a standard, instead those will help you to mitigate inconformity with standards such as ASVS and MSVS.
· MASVS is about mobile apps.
· ISO 22301 is about Business Continuity Management

answers.body: Follow CIS Benchmarks for secure configuration reference
Don’t need to change the default credentials
Use strong encryption mechanisms
Disable unused services and accounts

answers.body: Accept the code authored by your colleague if you are not a developer
Accept the code in which credentials are being hardcoded

draft_attributes.title: When you are assigned to perform a code review you may:

feedback.incorrect:
Why?
· Manual code review process must be performed by the developer, who is not the author of the reviewed code and must know the best industry standard in coding, including security best practices.
· Never store credentials in your source code! Use automatic tools eg. TruffleHog or GitGuardian to make sure there are no hardcoded credentials.
